pageContext.claim: “I respect China … but they’ve been killing us: $507 billion dollars in trade deficits last year.”
pageContext.analysis: The goods trade deficit with China was $375.6 billion in 2017, a figure that will probably be lower when trade in services is factored into the equation. Moreover, countries do not lose money on trade deficits. A deficit simply means that U.S. consumers bought more Chinese products than vice-versa.
